stuy
Class DriveTrain

java.lang.Object
  edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotDrive
      stuy.DriveTrain
All Implemented Interfaces:
edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.MotorSafety, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.parsing.IDevice, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.parsing.IUtility
public class DriveTrain
extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotDrive

A custom drive train class for our mecanum wheels. Uses PID based speed control on each of the four wheels.

Method Detail

mecanumDrive_Cartesian

public void mecanumDrive_Cartesian(double x,
                                   double y,
                                   double rotation,
                                   double gyroAngle,
                                   boolean deadband)
Call this method to drive the robot.

Parameters:
x - Horizontal component of the speed ("strafing")
y - Forward component of speed
rotation - Rotational speeds
gyroAngle - Gyro angle in order to do field-oriented drive (rotate speed vector by this angle to maintain constant orientation relative to the driver). Measured in degrees.
deadband - Whether to apply deadband (scaleInput()) on the driver inputs. All speed values (x, y, rotation) are from -1 to 1.

tankDrive3

public void tankDrive3(double left,
                       double right,
                       double strafe)
This is a joke method, do not use :P Three joystick drive! Drive the left and right sides like tank drive, plus horizontal strafing from a third input.

scaleInput

public static double scaleInput(double x)
Modify a joystick input to round any super-small values to 0. Should prevent robot from jittering when the joysticks have a small default value. Though small values are pulled down to 0, inputs higher than the specified threshold will still cover the entire range of outputs, though the rate at which the output grows is slightly steeper. This change should be small enough to still allow for good manual control. The graph of scaleInput's value (vertical axis) versus original joystick input (horizontal axis) looks like this: / / -1 _ _ _ / 1 / / /

Parameters:
x - A joystick value from -1 to 1.
Returns:
Close to the original input, but scaled to make small values return 0 while still allowing the full range of outputs, -1 to 1.
